page.title: 04HOUSING 1
page.content: The centre of population is Longborough village mentioned in the original Domesday as Longborge.There are approx. 200 properties built mainly of local Cotswold stone; disused quarries litter the locality.A small percentage of homes-5% are built of brick & 20% of Bradstone, artificial Cotswold stone blocks.In Donnington & outlying areas Cotswold stone is almost entirely used for building. Of the 200 proprties in Longborough 24 are originally Council houses, 10 are owned by Manor Farm, Upper Town Farm, Donnington's Brewery & the Church.The majority are owner-occupier. Several properties are second homes & are used only at weekends & holiday periods.
